Faults.message:
We're sorry about the power cut in the area. The power cutis affecting some properties in the area shown on the map, but not all. This iswhy you may notice some of your neighbours have power, but you dont. Itsnormal to see 1 in 3 homes affected. Were working with our engineers to fixthe problem as quickly as possible, and well keep you updated here on PowerTrack.

Engineers are on the way and will arrive in the area at 20:00 18/07/2025. When they get there, theyll work hard to fix the problem as quickly as possible. We'll keep you updated with any new information. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power back on by 00:30 19/07/2025.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'RH0019'
Faults.name: RG9 Area

In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. Faults.name: AB31 Area

Faults.message:
We're sorry about the power cut in the area. The power cutis affecting some properties in the area shown on the map, but not all. This iswhy you may notice some of your neighbours have power, but you dont. Itsnormal to see 1 in 3 homes affected. Were working with our engineers to fixthe problem as quickly as possible, and well keep you updated here on PowerTrack.

We're finding the closest engineer available. They'll be making their way to the area as soon as possible. When they're on their way, we'll let you know what time they'll be arriving. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power back on by23:00 18/07/2025.

The cause of this issue is low voltage on the network powering your home. There are various reasons why this could happen, and our engineers will get to the bottom of the cause, however, in many cases, it is because there is either a fault on our network which is not allowing enough electricity to travel through the cables, or there is too much electricity being used in the local area. Either way, the team working on this fault will get it sorted and will have your power back to normal as soon as possible. In the meantime, you should try to avoid using any non-essential appliances (such as washing machines and tumble dryers) this should mean your other appliances are able to work more effectively.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'RH0044'
Faults.name: DD10 Area
